args: You have a couple of letters, Marth.
Strange. How would anyone even know\nto send me a letter in this world?
You've helped a great deal of people\nsince you came here, after all.
I just did what I could.\nIt wasn't anything special.
I think the people you've helped\nwould beg to differ.
Regardless, I'll let you read in peace.
Hmm, she's right. It's a thank-you from the\nwoman we saved from fiends recently.
She didn't need to go out of her way to\nwrite this. ...Blast. Now I feel like I am\nthe one who should be thanking HER.
I imagine the other letter is simila...\nAh!
Now that you mention it, I've not seen\nhim for some time.
I hope nothing happened to him.
You are the ones who called for me?
We greatly appreciate your coming,\nYour Highness.
The letter bore a signature that read,\n＂Harle the Black Raven.＂ Are you he?
Harle is presently attending to another\nmatter, but he sent me to collect you.
Is it reasonable for me to assume that\nyou came here because you are interested\nin cooperating with us?
You refer to aiding your dragon hunt, yes?\nFirst, I must know why you made this\noffer in the first place.
We heard you once defeated an evil\ndragon in a great battle.
We would make use of that strength.
I have no desire to assist an empire that\nbrings its people naught but misery.\nTake your search elsewhere.
Ah, but are you not the Hero-King?
I fail to see the connection.
The Dyrenell Empire seeks to put an end\nto dragons' rule of the world.
Humans should make their own destiny.\nI believe you would agree, yes?
It is not the Empire who oppresses\nhumanity, but dragons—and dragons\nare your mortal foes, are they not?
Surely you were called here to take up\nthis mantle and eliminate the scourge\nof dragonkind from the world!
All you have heard of me is correct.
It is true that I defeated a dragon emperor\nin order to secure the peace of my people.
And we would have you reenact that\nselfsame legend here in our world!
Join us, Prince Marth! Join us in defeating\nthe traitorous prince who plots to create a\nworld ruled by the power of drag—
But! If you declare a being evil simply\nbecause it is a dragon, then you are no\ndifferent from the evil I once defeated.
I choose my blade's targets by the\ncontents of their hearts!
I came here to learn for myself what\nyou imperials would call justice.
I see now that our paths will never be the\nsame, and so I shall continue walking at\nPrince {player_name}'s side.
A shame. ...And also a shame that I must\nnow enact the second order given to me\nby Captain Harle.
For if you refused our offer,\nwe were told to eliminate you.
I suspected as much, though I hoped most\nfervently it would not come to this.
Extra rations for the man who brings me\nthe head of this coward!
I cannot allow myself to fall here...
For I must return to Altea! Haaaaaah!
Impressive—and yet you remain vastly\noutnumbered. At some point, Prince,\nyou WILL fall.
I found a torn-up letter in your room and\ntook the liberty of reassembling it.
Why the heck didn't you tell us you were\nheadin' out here, man? We're FRIENDS!
Maybe that's how ya do stuff where you\ncome from, but it ain't the way here!
Change of plan, men! The stranger no\nlonger matters—bring me the head of\nthat traitorous prince!
Thank you all for coming to my aid.
We should be thanking you, Marth.
I was happy that you rejected the\nEmpire's offer.
But are you sure that was the decision\nyou wanted to make in your heart?
...My mother was killed by a dragon.\nThey stole both my country and my family,\nand long have I hated them for such.
But killing and hate bring only more\nof the same.
I may not know exactly why I was brought\nto this world, but I DO know it was not\nsimply to vent my own resentments.
Besides, in this conflict, it is clear to me\nwhich side truly desires peace.
Thus, I choose to put my faith\nin your ideals...and your blade.
I won't let your trust be misplaced.
